IncidentDef.label: Psionic Brains
IncidentDef.description: Generates a tumorous growth within the brain of the colonist granting them a powerful psionic melee attack.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to be endowed with psychic power
IncidentDef.letterText: felt an intense pressure in their skull and looked on the world with new and strange eyes

IncidentDef.label: Aspect of Xen
IncidentDef.description: One of your colonist's limbs spontaneously remanifests as a powerful tentacle.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to be endowed with otherworldly parts
IncidentDef.letterText: looked around nervously to find who had been endowed with Xen's blessings

IncidentDef.label: Orbital Insanity Wave
IncidentDef.description: Causes a massive wave through the orbital layer of the region. This will cause ships to crash in the vicinity.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to send his dreams into the void as a beacon to those who pass
IncidentDef.letterText: felt Xen reach out and draw in vessels for your plunder

IncidentDef.label: Terrestrial Insanity Wave
IncidentDef.description: Causes a massive wave through the terrestrial layer of the region. All enemy humanoid pawns will be riddled with a crippling form of insanity.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and ask that he sends your foes into disarray
IncidentDef.letterText: cries out with victorious glee as Xen sends their enemies deep into madness

IncidentDef.label: Sunken Ship
IncidentDef.description: Delivers an ancient wreck from a distant seabed to your colony that can provide wood, steel, plasteel, and components when dismantled.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: out of desperation or greed, to deliver wealth from the sea
IncidentDef.letterText: is granted a vision of mists unveiling a wreckage from the sea

IncidentDef.label: Treasures of the Deep
IncidentDef.description: Brings forth lost treasure chests filled with valuable resources such as jade, silver, and gold from ancient ships lost to the abyssal seas.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: out of desperation or greed, to deliver wealth from the sea
IncidentDef.letterText: later finds chests of treasure with only damp handprints as evidence of those who left it

IncidentDef.label: Defend the Brood
IncidentDef.description: Brings a gang of deep ones to stand guard over your colony. Placement of the Sign of Dagon before casting this spell is recommended.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and ask that he protect his own
IncidentDef.letterText: hears a croaking off in the distance. And then another, and then a chorus

IncidentDef.label: Bounty of the Sea
IncidentDef.description: Xen tears a ship from the surface of a distant ocean and delivers its fresh corpse.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: out of desperation or greed, to deliver wealth from the sea
IncidentDef.letterText: hears a crash, then screaming, as the prize is delivered

IncidentDef.label: Horny Old Goats
IncidentDef.description: Summons a herd of black goats to provide your hunters with ample prey to hunt.
IncidentDef.letterText: can hear the wild screams of goats in the distance

IncidentDef.label: Transmogrify Pets
IncidentDef.description: Allow Xen to reseed the genetic structure of your beloved pet with extra-dimensional code and tentacles and stuff.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to bless their beasts with a touch of its extra-dimensional biology
IncidentDef.letterText: looks on as the skin of the chosen creature freaks the hell out.

IncidentDef.label: Extra Dimensional Butthole
IncidentDef.description: Summons a portal that spews Dark Young monsters to serve you as their loyal master until Xen deems otherwise.
IncidentDef.letterText: beholds vine-like tentacles erupt from the ground. The earth heaves and splits open as it craps out a horrendous atrocity.

IncidentDef.label: Starry Wisdom
IncidentDef.description: Transforms your executioner’s mind into a psychopathic one. Psychopaths will also be turned cannibalistic.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and give the dark one its toll of dreams in exchange for illumination
IncidentDef.letterText: has their mind open to the truth

IncidentDef.label: Forbidden Knowledge
IncidentDef.description: Grants a sizable bonus to your current research project.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and ask that he grants forbidden knowledge
IncidentDef.letterText: hears dark secrets scratched in the air by a whisper

IncidentDef.label: Chaos Theory
IncidentDef.description: Accept a deal from Nyarlathotep to live one’s life again. This removes all incapabilities from the executioner and changes their entire backstory.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and petition for another chance to correct mistakes from the past
IncidentDef.letterText: is sent back in time to before their birth to relive their life again

IncidentDef.label: Dark Emissary
IncidentDef.description: A new cult member joins your colony.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to bolster your ranks with his favoured

IncidentDef.label: The King in Yellow, Act I
IncidentDef.description: Acquire a reproduction of the infamous play, "The King in Yellow." Those exposed to the contents therin are downed and become cult-minded instantly.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and petition him to whisper the tale of the the Visitor, who wears no mask, and the doom that followed
IncidentDef.letterText: smiles with eagerness. They cannot wait to see how the play ends this time

IncidentDef.label: Summon Byakhee
IncidentDef.description: Summon a byakhee for defense and transport.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and beseech that he sends one of his hideous star-dwelling steeds
IncidentDef.letterText: hears unearthly screams and the beating of leathery wings from above

IncidentDef.label: The King in Yellow, Act II
IncidentDef.description: A proportion of the inhabitants will fall to dream of the lost city of Carcosa for 5-6 hours and shall awaken deeply calmed for a season.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and petition him for visions of the spires and balustrades of the distant and lost city of Carcosa
IncidentDef.letterText: feels the tendrils of sleep weave its way into their mind, to pull them away to distant Haydes, where Carcosa sits under black stars

IncidentDef.label: Unspeakable Oath
IncidentDef.description: The caster is granted a boon by Hastor but upon their death their body becomes his tool and plaything.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and swear and an unbreakable oath on his unspoken name
IncidentDef.letterText: realises that they are the only one who notices the masked stranger, slender in their yellow robes, and realises that their life is no longer their own
